items.title: Ancient Roman-era statues stolen from Syria national museum
items.summary_auto: Thieves broke into the national museum in the Syrian capital and stole several ancient statues dating back to the Roman era, officials said Tuesday.

items.title: Hundreds of thousands of homes without power across Quebec after heavy snowfall
items.summary_auto: Hundreds of thousands of households are without power Tuesday morning across Quebec after a first night of relentless snowfall brought as much as 35 centimeters of snow to parts of the province. Some school boards are asking that students stay at home.

items.title: Pride flags, fluoride, abortion: Here's what UCP will push Danielle Smith to change next
items.summary_auto: Alberta's premier likes to fulfil her party members' policy wishes. But do these ones coming to convention go too far?

items.title: Suicide bomber attacks outside Islamabad court, killing 12, says Pakistan’s interior minister
items.summary_auto: Pakistan’s interior minister says a suicide bomber detonated his explosives near a police vehicle outside the gate of a district court in Islamabad on Tuesday, killing 12 people and wounding 27.

items.title: 2 dead after small plane on hurricane relief mission to Jamaica crashes in Florida neighbourhood
items.summary_auto: A small turboprop plane on a hurricane relief mission to Jamaica crashed Monday morning into a pond in a gated residential neighbourhood of the Fort Lauderdale suburb of Coral Springs, killing two people shortly after takeoff and narrowly missing homes, authorities and a local resident said.

items.title: Yemen's Houthi rebels signal that they've stopped attacks on Israel and Red Sea shipping
items.summary_auto: Yemen's Houthi rebels are signalling they've stopped their attacks against Israel and shipping in the Red Sea as a shaky ceasefire holds in the Gaza Strip.

items.title: More than 260 Quebec doctors apply for Ontario licences following pay reform bill
items.summary_auto: Over 250 Quebec doctors are applying to be able to work in Ontario, according to the College of Physicians and Surgeons of Ontario. The surge of applications is happening in the wake of a controversial bill reforming doctors’ pay, which was passed on Oct. 25 in Quebec.

items.title: Nick Fuentes and the mainstreaming of neo-Nazism
items.summary_auto: As Republicans argue over far right streamer Nick Fuentes, a conversation about the mainstreaming of antisemitism, neo-Nazi beliefs and the fight it has sparked in U.S. conservatism.

items.title: Mysterious drones keep buzzing key sites in Europe. So what's the defence strategy?
items.summary_auto: Belgium is the latest target in a string of mysterious drone incidents across Europe, with some officials directly pointing the finger at Russia. It has left authorities scrambling to boost defences.

items.title: Canada opening new consulate in Greenland this week, in a bid for closer relations
items.summary_auto: Foreign Affairs Minister Anita Anand will travel to Greenland's capital, Nuuk, this week to open a new Canadian consulate as both allies seek to strengthen ties amid turbulent relations with the United States.

items.title: What does remembrance mean when war is livestreamed?
items.summary_auto: Remembrance Day is about looking back. It’s about a collective memory of war, sacrifice and reflection. But today, conflict isn’t confined to the past; it streams live to our phones 24/7.

items.title: Canada's Unknown Soldier in 2025: Where science collides with sacred symbolism
items.summary_auto: Canada's Unknown Soldier — a casualty of the First World War — was brought home to be interred in Ottawa 25 years ago, and the Commonwealth War Graves Commission forbids any attempt at identification. Advances in DNA technology mean that in future wars, the chances that soldiers won't be identified are slim. Does the concept of an Unknown Soldier still have meaning to a new, on-demand generation, or will it become a relic of a bygone era?

items.title: Ontario considering order that would kill hundreds of new rental homes
items.summary_auto: Ontario’s housing minister is considering stepping in to quash a proposed rental development in north Toronto, over concerns raised by a pharmaceutical company.

items.title: How a tight-knit Mi'kmaw community honours its veterans for Remembrance Day
items.summary_auto: Eel River Bar First Nation, a small Mi'kmaw community in northern New Brunswick honours its veterans by hanging banners each year.

items.title: Prince George man found guilty of 1st-degree murder in stabbing death of young mother
items.summary_auto: A B.C. Supreme Court Justice found 25-year-old Zain Xavier Wood guilty of first-degree murder for fatally stabbing a Prince George, B.C., mother in front of her two children in 2023.

items.title: TikTok influencer executed by armed men in Mali: mayor
items.summary_auto: Armed men in Mali killed a TikTok influencer who had posted videos in support of the West African nation's military, authorities said Monday.

items.title: DFO investigating 3rd whale death off B.C.'s coast within weeks
items.summary_auto: Caitlin Birdsall, executive director of the Marine Education and Research Society, says the whale discovered Nov. 8 off Lasqueti Island in the Georgia Strait near the Sunshine Coast and is the third confirmed death since late September.

items.title: New flu strain could hit infants, elderly hard | Hanomansing Tonight
items.summary_auto: With flu cases now rising in Canada, medical experts are bracing for a difficult influenza season linked to the global spread of an evolving H3N2 strain that could be a mismatch for this year’s vaccine.

items.title: Trump's threat of a billion-dollar lawsuit adds to the BBC's existential crisis
AFC Toronto thumps Montreal Roses FC en route to NSL final
items.summary_auto: Esther Okoronkwo scored three times in the first 27 minutes of Monday's semifinal match at snow-covered York Lions Stadium and the regular-season champion AFC Toronto defeated the visiting Montreal Roses 4-1, taking the two-leg aggregate 6-1.

items.title: Anand says U.S. secretary Rubio has avoided '51st state' chatter as G7 meeting looms
items.summary_auto: Foreign Affairs Minister Anita Anand says U.S. Secretary of State Marco Rubio hasn't repeated President Donald Trump's musings about making Canada the 51st state during their conversations.

items.title: UN climate talks in Brazil kick off with a focus on implementing existing promises
items.summary_auto: U.N. climate negotiations began Monday on the edge of the Brazilian Amazon as leaders pushed for accelerating efforts to curb global warming by drastically reducing the carbon pollution that causes it. But top U.S. negotiators were absent.

items.title: MLB, sportsbooks cap bets on individual pitches in response to pitch rigging scandal
items.summary_auto: Major League Baseball said its authorized gaming operators will cap bets on individual pitches at $200 US and exclude them from parlays, a day after two Cleveland Guardians were indicted and accused of rigging pitches at the behest of gamblers.

items.title: Alabamian who mistakenly ordered from N.S. burger joint sends cash and apology by mail
items.summary_auto: The owners of Bentley’s Burgers and Fries in West Chezzetcook, N.S., were gobsmacked this week when they received a handwritten apology letter all the way from Alabama, along with $40 US in cash to pay for an unclaimed order of two burgers and fries.

items.title: Canadian-born author David Szalay awarded 2025 Booker Prize for Flesh
Children's aid workers didn't record key info, missed red flags before boy’s death, Milton, Ont., trial told
items.summary_auto: A child protection worker was back in the witness box at the Milton, Ont., murder trial for Becky Hamber and Brandy Cooney to testify about the Children’s Aid Society’s involvement with the couple and the two boys they were trying to adopt.

items.title: PWHL to visit 6 Canadian cities on Takeover Tour
items.summary_auto: As the league continues to eye expansion, the PWHL will play 16 neutral-site games this upcoming season. In addition to returning to Edmonton and Quebec City, the PWHL will make stops in Calgary, Winnipeg, Hamilton and Halifax.
